channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Tanzania's President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote
item.description: KAMPALA, Uganda (AP) — Tanzania's President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced Saturday. Her two main opponents had both been prevented from running, leaving her virtually unopposed.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: With pharaoh-fanfare, Egypt unveils a huge new museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — In an extravaganza of pharaonic imagery with a drone light show depicting ancient gods and pyramids in the sky, Egypt on Saturday inaugurated its long-delayed Grand Egyptian Museum, a megaproject aiming to give the country’s millennia-old heritage a rich, modern display.
item.dc:creator: SAMY MAGDY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Aid efforts struggle to bring relief to parts of hurricane-stricken Jamaica
item.description: Rescuers and aid workers have spread across Jamaica to deliver food and water after Hurricane Melissa ravaged the island.
item.dc:creator: John Myers, Jr., Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Aid efforts struggle to bring relief to parts of hurricane-stricken Jamaica
item.description: Rescuers and aid workers have spread across Jamaica to deliver food and water after Hurricane Melissa ravaged the island.
item.dc:creator: John Myers, Jr., Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Israel says remains of three people handed over by Hamas do not match any deceased hostages
item.description: Israel's forensic testing reveals that remains of three people returned by Hamas don't match any of the deceased hostages from the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Japan deploys military after record bear attacks across country
item.description: Bear attacks in Japan reach historic levels as poor harvests and shrinking hunter population create wildlife crisis in northern prefectures like Akita and Fukushima.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: Ukrainian forces have hit a crucial fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, according to Ukraine's military intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Samya Kullab, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Pentagon says Ukraine can have Tomahawk missiles: Report
item.description: The Pentagon has given approval to the White House to send long-range Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine, potentially fulfilling President Volodymyr Zelensky's desire for more weapons in his country's war with Russia if President Trump provides the final green light, CNN reported Friday.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Mancini, The Hill

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, The Hill

item.title: Red Cross confirms remains of three hostages return to Israel ‘for the first time’ as families await answers
item.description: The International Red Cross oversaw a body transfer under humanitarian law as parties work to return the deceased to families during the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump won't send 'high level' representatives to COP30 climate summit
item.description: The U.S. won’t be sending any “high level” representatives to this year’s United Nations climate summit, a White House official told The Hill on Friday. The summit, known as COP30, will be held in Brazil next month.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Frazin, The Hill

item.title: Andrew, the civilian formerly known as 'prince,' faces an uncertain future
item.description: LONDON (AP) — He has lost his title as prince, lost his rent-free mansion on the sprawling grounds next to Windsor Castle and lost whatever remained of his reputation in the public eye.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: UN human rights chief calls on Pentagon to halt strikes on suspected drug boats
item.description: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called for the Pentagon to halt boat strikes against vessels suspected to be carrying drugs in order to prevent “extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Russia deploys 170,000 troops for push in Ukraine's Donetsk region, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia has deployed around 170,000 troops in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region where they are trying to capture the stronghold of Pokrovsk in a major push for a battlefield victory, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday.
item.dc:creator: ILLIA NOVIKOV, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Aid teams flock to Jamaica to help with Hurricane Melissa recovery
item.description: David Archer, deputy governor of the British Virgin Islands, told NewsNation he's seen many organizations eager to help.
item.dc:creator: Anna Kutz, NewsNation

item.title: Yemen will put captured UN staff on trial
item.description: Yemen says UN workers helped Israel with airstrikes, and will put UN employees on trial. 36 UN staffers were arrested in Yemen.
item.dc:creator: Abdulrhman Al-Ansi and Khaled Abdullah, NewsNation

item.title: Ex-Mossad chief behind Iran nuclear warehouse raid says Iran’s atomic sites ‘obliterated,’ credits Trump
item.description: Former Mossad director reveals Iran's nuclear sites were "obliterated" in U.S. strikes, warns Tehran that Israel "can come again" if uranium enrichment resumes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US defense chief vows to 'stoutly defend' Indo-Pacific interests in talks with China
item.description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP) — The U.S. Secretary of Defense said Friday he told his Chinese counterpart during talks in Malaysia that Washington would “stoutly defend” its interests in the Indo-Pacific. He also signed a new agreement aimed at strengthening security ties with India.
item.dc:creator: EILEEN NG, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — The rumble of large machinery, whine of chain saws and chopping of machetes echoed through communities across the northern Caribbean on Thursday as they dug out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa and surveyed the damage left behind.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: LONDON (AP) — King Charles III on Thursday stripped his disgraced brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicted him from his royal residence after weeks of pressure to act over his relationship with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Buckingham Palace said.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY and JILL LAWLESS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: US orders nonemergency personnel to leave Mali
item.description: The State Department ordered non-emergency employees to leave Mali as the government there comes under increasing pressure from al Qaeda-linked insurgents.
item.dc:creator: Daphne Psaledakis, NewsNation

item.title: Five more arrested in Louvre heist investigation as stolen crown jewels worth $102M still missing
item.description: Five more arrests made in Louvre heist investigation as French crown jewels worth $102 million remain missing after daring daytime theft from Paris museum.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump cuts China tariff after Xi signals tougher fentanyl enforcement, rare-earth pause
item.description: Trump announced a cut on Chinese imports after meeting with Xi in South Korea, citing new understandings on fentanyl enforcement, farm trade and rare-earth exports.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Mexican president disagrees with US revoking 13 Mexican airline routes
item.description: Sheinbaum added she will meet with Mexican airlines on Friday to gain insight into their perspective on the matter.
item.dc:creator: Raul Cortes, Natalia Siniawski, Franklin Paul, NewsNation

item.title: Trump extends friendly hand to Xi in fraught relationship with China
item.description: Friday's meeting marks the first time the two leaders have seen each other face-to-face in six years.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, NewsNation

item.title: Hamas victim memorial featuring Shiri Bibas and sons targeted by vandals in Milan, Italy
item.description: Artist AleXsandro Palombo calls the defacement of his Bibas family memorial mural in Milan an antisemitic act disguised as activism rather than legitimate protest.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Texas honeymooners trapped in Jamaica as Category 5 Hurricane Melissa slams island
item.description: Texas newlyweds Kasydee and Hunter Bishop are trapped near Montego Bay, Jamaica, as Hurricane Melissa approaches as a Category 5 storm with 175 mph winds.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Plane crashes while flying tourists to Kenya's Maasai Mara, killing 11 people
item.description: NAIROBI, Kenya (AP) — A plane crash killed 11 people, mostly foreign tourists, in Kenya’s coastal region of Kwale early Tuesday while they were en route to the Maasai Mara National Reserve in heavy rain.
item.dc:creator: EVELYNE MUSAMBI, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump addresses US troops in Japan, pens rare earths deal
item.description: While meeting with new Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi in Tokyo on Tuesday, Trump referred to Japan as an "ally at the strongest level.
item.dc:creator: Tom Dempsey, NewsNation
